dictionary

Interface DictionaryInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Dictionary

    public interface DictionaryInterface

    Title: Dictionary Interface - A component of the Dictionary system

    Description: The interface between the Dictionary and user interfaces (textual and/or graphical)

    Copyright: Copyright Â© 2018

    Version:
    2.00 - Baseline for transition from Swing to JavaFX 2018-05-05
    Author:
    Lynn Robert Carter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEntry(java.lang.String w, java.lang.String d)
      Add a dictionary entry to the dictionary
      java.lang.String findAll(java.lang.String target)
      Return a formatted String of the sequence of dictionary entries whose words contain the target String in the order they were found in the dictionary and separated by a line containing a number of dashes.
      DictEntry findNextEntry()
      Return the next dictionary entry whose word contains the String specified by the most recent call to the setSearchString method call.
      int getCurrentIndex()
      Get the index of the current entry
      DictEntry getDictEntry(int ndx)
      Return a DictEntry object specified by the zero-based index ndx.
      int getNumEntries()
      Provides the number of entries in the dictionary as the returned value.
      java.lang.String listAll()
      Returns a formatted String containing all of the entries from the dictionary
      void remove()
      Remove a DictEntry from the dictionary that has been most recently found by the findNextEntry method.
      void setCurrentIndex(int ndx)
      Set the index of the current entry
      void setSearchString(java.lang.String s)
      Resets internal state attributes so a sequence of findNextEntry calls can return all of the entries whose word contains the specified string (somewhere in the word) at least once

    • Method Detail

      • addEntry

        void addEntry(java.lang.String w,
              java.lang.String d)
        Add a dictionary entry to the dictionary
        Parameters:
        w - is the word being added to the dictionary
        d - is the definition of the word being added to the dictionary

      • getNumEntries

        int getNumEntries()
        Provides the number of entries in the dictionary as the returned value.
        Returns:
        the number of dictionary entries

      • setSearchString

        void setSearchString(java.lang.String s)
        Resets internal state attributes so a sequence of findNextEntry calls can return all of the entries whose word contains the specified string (somewhere in the word) at least once
        Parameters:
        s - is the string that must be found in the word

      • findNextEntry

        DictEntry findNextEntry()
        Return the next dictionary entry whose word contains the String specified by the most recent call to the setSearchString method call. Each call to the findNextEntry methods returns the next dictionary entry from the sequence of entries containing the string. After the last dictionary entry is returned (or if no dictionary entry contains the specified string), a null is returned.
        Returns:
        the found DictEntry to the caller

      • findAll

        java.lang.String findAll(java.lang.String target)
        Return a formatted String of the sequence of dictionary entries whose words contain the target String in the order they were found in the dictionary and separated by a line containing a number of dashes.
        Parameters:
        target - is the String used to find the sequence of words.
        Returns:
        the formatted string to the caller

      • getDictEntry

        DictEntry getDictEntry(int ndx)
        Return a DictEntry object specified by the zero-based index ndx.
        Parameters:
        ndx - is the zero-based index of the DictEntry object to be returned.
        Returns:
        the specified DictEntry to the caller. If the index is negative or larger than the number of elements in the dictionary, null should be returned.

      • remove

        void remove()
        Remove a DictEntry from the dictionary that has been most recently found by the findNextEntry method. If that method has not been called or it did not find a DictEntry, this method should just return. If the method has been called and a DictEntry had been found, this remove routine should remove it and update the dictionary's attributes to reflect the change.

      • listAll

        java.lang.String listAll()
        Returns a formatted String containing all of the entries from the dictionary
        Returns:
        the formatted String

      • getCurrentIndex

        int getCurrentIndex()
        Get the index of the current entry
        Returns:
        - an index

      • setCurrentIndex

        void setCurrentIndex(int ndx)
        Set the index of the current entry
